pros: flexible hours, PTO, benefits, good wages, bonuses
cons: no growth opportunities unless you push for them yourself

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Winston-Salem, NC
cons: Cnas are worked really short and pulled to areas they are not familiar with. Management talks down to workers, and when they see you are short staffed they do not help. Strict attendance policy, you could be in the hospital and they threaten to write you up. Little care for staff and honestly the residents.

review_title: I wish I had been better appreciated.

review_title: Don’ t let the pretty setting fool you
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Winston-Salem, NC
pros: None really, except the bulidings are pretty
cons:
This is a facility for rich people. If you want to be treated like a servant; rather than a nurse; then this is the place for you. I have worked in Nursing many years and have never seen such back stabbing. They really do fit the song “ smile in your face, all the time they want to take your place: BACKSTABBERS”
Do not let the nice buildings and grounds, fool you.  The staff only pretend to work together, while spending most of their time talking badly about the residents and other staff members. The pay may sound good, and the benefits, but its not worth the way you will be treated. Some of the residents even have “nanny cams” so their families can watch your every move. That should tell you right away: that there is a big problem at this facility. I know for a fact that managers talk very badly about the staff members, and even team up ones that they know will have issues with one another.  Trust me, you do not want to ever work for Arbor Acres.

pros: Arbor Acres is the most amazing place.  My first observation was that employees are so happy to be working there and it really shows in the work they do with residents!  It's definitely a place I love going to every day!
cons: Because there is not a position for a Licensed Professional Counselor I will have to leave after internship; otherwise I would be the first to apply!

review_title: Turn around and walk the other way
pros: Some of the employees are pretty great people.
cons: RUN AWAY!! This place is a mismanaged mess with poor leadership. The stress level here is through the roof and I remember at least 2 people dying from heart attack. They will work you relentlessly, misdirect you and then blame you. Do yourself a favor and find another place.

pros: Beautiful campus; beautiful people to work with;always given everything needed to succeed no matter what.
cons: Coinfdentialy with senior management.  Not enough interest given to sort out the politics of organization.  Rather than the ability to express real concerns, touchy issues are skirted around not enabling one to understand what's truly expected of them.

pros: Beautiful environment and many wonderful co-workers. Pay scale is excellent for the area.
cons: If you don't fit the mold, you will not be here long. Senior management is very ostentatious!!! If you're not part of their group you will be shown the door with no warning. Sad as the residents and majority of staff are fabulous.

pros: Tuition reimbursement, team work, shift diff., great benefits, did I mention good teamwork! Seems like a good place for students to work
cons: I don't have any cons right now due to being a new employee but certainly will update in 90 days'

review_title: Don't stop for a second look
pros: Many great people to work with! Resident are nice and a wonderful service is being provided to those financially able.
cons: Management is trying to create a new inclusive work environment. However their communication with staff that are not department heads is non- existent. Poor training practices.

pros: Understanding and compassionate management.  Excellent environment.
cons: Rare opportunity to advance your career.
